channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Americans missed out on a ‘once-in-a-lifetime’ chance to buy a house—the 3 shifts it would take to make housing affordable are ‘very unlikely’
item.description: “We see the housing market remaining relatively stuck without major progress being made on affordability,” home construction CEO says.

item.title: The Agentic AI Shift Coming in 2026
AI Expert Predicted AI Would End Humanity in 2027—Now He’s Changing His Timeline
item.description: The former OpenAI employee has rescheduled the end of the world.

item.title: GameStop says CEO compensation package doesn’t include any guaranteed pay
item.description: GameStop is providing details on a new compensation package for CEO Ryan Cohen that is dependent on him meeting certain “significant” performance targ...

item.title: Job openings drop to 2nd lowest level in 5 years in November
item.description: U.S. employers posted far fewer jobs in November than the previous month , a sign that employers aren’t yet ramping up hiring even as growth has picke...

item.title: The Trump administration just gave the food pyramid a Sweetgreen makeover
item.description: President Donald Trump’s administration has introduced a new, inverted food pyramid with fewer food groups. The new three-section food pyramid is part...

item.title: OpenAI launches ChatGPT Health in a push to become a hub for personal health data
item.description: The new consumer-facing product lets users connect medical records, wellness apps, and wearable data, extending the way in which millions of people al...

item.title: The AI Ad Backlash Is Here, and Big Brands Are Leaning In
item.description: While some brands use AI to try to get attention, others are explicitly pushing back on the technology.

item.title: Jensen Huang might be fine with a billionaires tax, but Google cofounder Larry Page is already dumping California
item.description: Page converted several of his assets out of California before the end of 2025, according to state filings.

item.title: Chick-fil-A Just Launched a Huge Marketing Campaign—But Some Customers Are Unhappy
item.description: The fast-food chain will be rolling out retro packaging and drinks for its 80th anniversary.

item.title: The psychology of the ‘Chicken Little’ coworker

item.title: Here’s What it Would Cost George Clooney to Renounce His U.S. Citizenship
item.description: The famed actor secured French citizenship in December.

item.title: Octopus Prime: Inside a growing and controversial farming effort
item.description: Octopuses are brilliant, emotional, and mysterious. Can they ever be farmed humanely? And if they can, should they be? Fast Company contributor Clint ...

item.title: Trump’s Greenland takeover would require ‘billions upon billions’ spent over decades to acquire a mineral industry that doesn’t yet exist, experts say
item.description: As the White House confirms military force is "always an option," experts say the costs—financial, strategic, and geopolitical—will be staggering.

item.title: RFK Jr. is pushing Americans to eat more red meat and dairy as Starbucks, Chipotle, and others cash in on protein craze
item.description: Americans want more protein in their diets, and brands have been happy to oblige.
